title: 28. THANKSGIVING PUNCH
info:
THANKSGIVING PUNCH

ingredients

2 1/2 cups Southern Comfort
2 1/4 quarts 7-up
6 oz fresh lemon juice
1-6 oz can frozen O.J.
2-6 oz can frozen lemonade

preparation

Chill ingredients. Mix in Punch bowl adding 7-up last. Add a few drops of red food coloring, orange slices & lemon Slices.

title: 146. THANKSGIVING BROWN SUGAR BROWNIES
info:
THANKSGIVING BROWN SUGAR BROWNIES

ingredients

2/3 c. butter, melted
2 c. packed brown sugar
3 eggs
1 c. flour
1 tsp. vanilla
2 c. nuts

preparation

Melt butter, then add brown sugar. Add eggs, flour, vanilla and nuts. Mix and put mixture into oblong pan. Bake at 350째 for 30 minutes. Remove and let partially cool. Cut into squares.

title: 75. THANKSGIVING TOMORROW
info:
THANKSGIVING TOMORROW

ingredients

2 c. turkey, cooked and cubed
3 c. leftover stuffing
1 can low-sodium cream of mushroom soup
1/2 c. chopped celery
1/2 c. chopped onion
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 tsp. poultry seasoning
turkey broth or water if needed

preparation

Heat oven to 350째. Combine all ingredients, add turkey broth or water if mixture is too dry. Place in lightly greased casserole dish. Bake 35 or 45 minutes or until hot and lightly browned on top. Garnish with cranberry sauce if desired.

title: 27. THANKSGIVING YAMS
info:
THANKSGIVING YAMS

ingredients

3 c. mashed yams
1/3 c. milk
1 tsp. vanilla
1/3 c. Kahlua or Amaretto or a mix of the 2
1 tsp. orange juice
3/4 c. sugar
1/3 c. butter
1 tsp. cinnamon (more if you like)
1 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Mix all ingredients in a casserole dish.

Topping:

ingredients

1/3 c. flour
1 c. chopped pecans
1/3 c. margarine
1 c. brown sugar

preparation

Combine ingredients in a separate bowl. Sprinkle topping on top of yams. Bake 30 minutes at 350째.

title: 106. THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

2 to 3 stalks celery, chopped
1 medium onion, chopped fine
1 lb. hot or medium sausage
1 lb. regular sausage
6 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
1 egg, slightly beaten
1 to 2 c. gravy or turkey drippings
1/2 to 1 c. chopped turkey meat

preparation

Place all of the ingredients in a bowl and mix. Add sage or poultry seasoning to flavor. Place in 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350째 for 20 to 30 minutes.

This casserole is good with grits as a breakfast treat!

title: 43. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients

1 lb. cranberries
1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
3/4 c. cane sugar
2 c. whipping cream or 8 oz. Cool Whip
3/4 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Grind cranberries fine. Add pineapple and sugar. Stir well. Let stand in refrigerator overnight (covered). Two hours before serving, whip cream. Add nuts. Place in a serving bowl and chill.

title: 81. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY JELLO SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY JELLO SALAD

ingredients

1 (16 oz.) pkg. cranberries
1 c. water
1 large pkg. Jell-O (cherry, strawberry or raspberry)
1 c. sugar
1 can crushed pineapple, drained
1 c. chopped celery
1 c. halved grapes
1 c. Cool Whip
1 c. nuts
2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
1 c. Marshmallow Creme

preparation

Cook cranberries in water until they pop open. Add Jell-O and sugar. Mix until Jell-O dissolves. Set until cool. Add pineapple, celery, grapes and nuts. Set.

Topping: Mix Cool Whip, cream cheese (softened) and Marshmallow Creme. Spread over cranberry mixture. Set and chill overnight.

title: 83. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY DELIGHT
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY DELIGHT

ingredients

1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple (juice drained and reserved)
1 c. water
1 (6 oz.) pkg. strawberry flavored gelatin
1 (6 oz.) can whole berry cranberry sauce
3 tsp. lemon juice
1 Tbsp. lemon peel
1/2 tsp. nutmeg
2 c. sour cream
1/2 c. chopped pecans
fresh strawberries (optional)

preparation

Combine pineapple juice and water in a 2-quart saucepan. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Add gelatin and stir until dissolved. Stir in cranberry sauce, lemon juice, peel and nutmeg. Chill until mixture thickens slightly. Add sour cream; stir until thoroughly combined. Fold in pineapple and pecans. Pour into 8-cup mold. Chill until firm. Unmold onto serving plate. Garnish with strawberries.

title: 130. DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING TURKEY SOUP
info:
DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING TURKEY SOUP

ingredients

3 Tbsp. butter
1 onion, chopped
1 clove garlic, minced
1 carrot, sliced
1 celery stalk, sliced
2 or more c. leftover cooked turkey, diced
6 c. turkey stock or chicken broth (homemade or canned)
1/2 tsp. white pepper
3 Tbsp. chopped parsley
1 potato, cubed
salt to taste
1 c. heavy sweet cream

preparation

Heat butter in a skillet and saute onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Transfer contents of the skillet into a slow cooker. Add all other ingredients except the cream. Cover, turn on low and cook for about 6 hours or until the vegetables are tender. Stir in heavy cream and heat thoroughly before serving. Serves 8.

title: 16. THANKSGIVING PICKLES
info:
THANKSGIVING PICKLES

ingredients

2 c. vinegar
2 Tbsp. salt
1 1/2 Tbsp. whole mixed spices
1 Tbsp. powdered alum
cucumbers

preparation

Pack whole cucumbers in 1/2 gallon jar. Mix vinegar, salt, spices and alum together. Pour over cucumbers. Finish filling jar with cold water. Put Saran Wrap on jar; seal tight and set aside. In fall when you want to eat, take out of jar and dry off. Slice pickles about 1 1/2-inches thick. Pour about 1 1/2 pounds sugar over them; seal and shake jar to dissolve sugar. Leave in refrigerator as you use them. The longer they set, the crispier they get.

title: 109. THANKSGIVING CAKE
info:
THANKSGIVING CAKE

ingredients

2 sticks butter (1 c.)
5 eggs
1 c. evaporated milk
1 c. raisins
1 c. coconut
1 tsp. vanilla
2 c. sugar
1 (14 oz.) box vanilla wafers, crushed
1 (16 oz.) container fruit cake mix or candied fruit
2 c. pecans, chopped

preparation

Cream butter until light. Add sugar slowly, beating well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each, then add wafer crumbs alternating with milk. Add vanilla extract. Add coconut, then mix fruit, nuts and raisins into bowl with 1/4 cup flour. Cover well and shake, dusting well with flour, then mix with batter. Pour in well-greased and papered tube pan. Cook 1 1/2 hours at 325째, then let cool.

title: 29. THANKSGIVING CANDLELIGHT PUNCH
info:
THANKSGIVING CANDLELIGHT PUNCH

ingredients

1 (46 oz.) can apricot nectar
12 (7 oz.) bottles Sprite
2 (6 oz.) cans frozen concentrated orange juice, thawed
2 (12 oz.) pkg. frozen peaches, slightly thawed
1 pt. vanilla ice cream

preparation

Chill the apricot nectar and Sprite. Just before serving time, combine the apricot nectar and concentrated orange juice in the punch bowl. Slowly pour in chilled Sprite. Add peaches and float generous spoonfuls of ice cream on top of the punch. Serves 35.

title: 147. THANKSGIVING POTATOES
info:
THANKSGIVING POTATOES

ingredients

9 large baking potatoes, peeled and diced
1/2 c. (1 stick) unsalted butter (room temperature)
12 oz. cream cheese (room temperature)
3/4 c. sour cream
1/2 tsp. ground nutmeg
salt to taste
pepper to taste

preparation

Place the diced potatoes in a large saucepan and add water to cover. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer over medium heat until tender. Drain. Place the potatoes in a mixer bowl. Cut the butter and cream cheese into small pieces and add to the potatoes. Beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the sour cream. Season with nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or reheat in a buttered casserole at 300째 for 20 minutes, if you want to prepare them in advance. Yields 8 servings.

title: 76. THANKSGIVING TREATS
info:
THANKSGIVING TREATS

ingredients

2 2/3 c. coconut (7 oz.)
2/3 c. sugar
1/4 c. flour
1/4 tsp. salt
1 tsp. almond extract
1 c. chopped nuts
4 egg whites

preparation

Heat oven to 325째. Mix together coconut, sugar, flour and salt. Stir in egg whites and almond extract; mix well. Stir in nuts; mix well. Drop from teaspoon onto lightly greased baking sheets. Bake 20 minutes or until edge of cookies are golden brown. Remove from baking sheet immediately. Let cool and serve. Makes about 30 cookies. So pretty and so easy!

title: 54. THANKSGIVING ONION PIE
info:
THANKSGIVING ONION PIE

ingredients

4 onions
1 Tbsp. butter
4 slices bread
1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
2 eggs
1/4 tsp. pepper
1 c. milk

preparation

Slice onions and saute in butter. Toast bread and butter, if desired. Cut toast into 1-inch cubes. Layer in 1 1/2-quart casserole pan. Spread onions on top of bread cubes. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over onions. Beat eggs. Add pepper and milk. Pour this mixture over top of ingredients. Cover and chill 6 hours. Bake, uncovered, at 350째 about 30 minutes.

title: 38. THANKSGIVING DINNER CASSEROLE
info:
THANKSGIVING DINNER CASSEROLE

ingredients

2 (8 oz.) pkg. Pepperidge Farm dressing pkg.
2 sticks butter, melted
2 c. chicken broth
3 c. diced chicken or turkey
1 c. onion, chopped
1 c. celery, chopped
1 c. mayo
4 eggs, slightly beaten
3 c. milk
2 cans mushroom soup
grated cheese

preparation

Mix and divide Pepperidge Farm dressing, butter and chicken broth. Put half in bottom of baking pan.

Mix chicken or turkey, onion, celery and mayo thoroughly and spread over dressing in pan.

Beat eggs slightly with milk. Pour over contents. Cover top with other half of bread stuffing. Cover with Saran Wrap and leave in refrigerator overnight. Take out 1 hour before baking. Spread mushroom soup over top. Bake uncovered at 325째 for 40 minutes. Spread grated cheese over top and return to oven for 10 minutes. Will serve 24 or more.

Recipe can be easily cut in half. Use two fryer broiler chickens, approximately 3 pounds each for 6 cups chicken. Bake chicken before adding to casserole. Turkey can be substituted.

title: 143. THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

1 recipe Pinkie's Cornbread
12 biscuits, crumbled
15 slices bread, crumbled
6 c. good turkey or chicken stock
1 1/2 c. cream of chicken soup
6 large eggs
1 c. melted butter
2 c. celery, chopped
2 Tbsp. m.s.g. (Accent)
1 Tbsp. black pepper
1 tsp. salt or less
1 tsp. poultry seasoning
pinch of celery seed
2 c. chopped onion

preparation

Mix all ingredients together in casserole dishes sprayed with Pam. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Serve with gravy and cranberry sauce. Serves 25.

Pinkie's Cornbread:

ingredients

4 c. cornmeal (self-rising)
2 c. buttermilk
6 eggs
2 sticks melted butter

preparation

Mix all ingredients together and pour into a greased 9 x 13 x 1/2-inch pan; bake at 375째 for 20 to 25 minutes. Great for making ahead and freezing.

title: 132. JUDY'S THANKSGIVING POTATOES

JUDY'S THANKSGIVING POTATOES

milk

preparation

Combine and place in a greased 9 x 13-inch casserole dish. Bake 1 hour at 350째.

title: 149. THANKSGIVING FRUIT SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING FRUIT SALAD

ingredients

1 lb. whole cranberry sauce
1 1/4 lb. jar unsweetened applesauce
nuts (if desired)
1 lb. can crushed pineapple, drained
1/4 tsp. allspice
1/4 tsp. cinnamon
1 c. raisins

preparation

Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use. Keeps well for a week.

title: 51. THANKSGIVING DINNER
info:
THANKSGIVING DINNER

ingredients

1 car (or some mode of transportation)
1 tank of gas (depends on distance to drive)
1 pocket of money (for gas, depends on second ingredient)
1 empty stomach (or 2 if you bring your spouse and more if you bring the children)
1 safe trip to your mother's house

preparation

Depending on how far you have to drive (pack clothes for an overnight trip) get up early on Thanksgiving Day and go to your mother's house.

If traveling a long distance use plenty of second and third ingredients. Upon arriving at your destination, prepare your nostrils for some luscious mouth-watering smells. Help your mother prepare a wonderful dinner (or stay out of the way). Sit down at the table, say grace, and enjoy, enjoy, enjoy. To help make the dinner more enjoyable (especially to your mother) wash the dishes.

title: 131. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY APPLE SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY APPLE SALAD

ingredients

4 c. fresh cranberries
2 tsp. grated orange rind
1 c. sugar
1 (6 oz.) pkg. lemon jello
2 c. boiling water
1 c. cold water
1 c. finely diced celery
2 apples, diced

preparation

Wash and grind the raw cranberries and combine with orange rind and sugar. Let stand 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, dissolve gelatin in the boiling water. Add the cold water and chill until slightly congealed and syrupy. Add the cranberries, celery and apple. Turn into a mold that has been rinsed in cold water. Chill. Makes 12 servings.

title: 101. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients

1 large box cherry or raspberry jello
1 jar cran-orange sauce
1 c. chopped celery
1 c. walnuts, chopped
2 c. sour cream

preparation

Make jello, less 1 cup water called for. Chill for 15 minutes. Stir in cran-orange sauce. Chill 30 minutes. Stir in celery and walnuts. Pour 1/2 of jello mix into a bowl; spread with sour cream. Spoon remaining jello over the top. Chill overnight.

title: 140. THANKSGIVING ROLLS
info:
THANKSGIVING ROLLS

ingredients

2 pkg. yeast
2 c. warm water
1 tsp. salt
2 Tbsp. sugar
1 c. butter
2 eggs
3/4 c. sugar
6 c. flour

preparation

Dissolve salt, yeast, water and 2 tablespoons sugar. Melt butter and add to yeast mixture. Beat eggs and add to mixture. Add 3/4 cup sugar and flour; mix well. Let rise to double. Roll 1/4-inch and cut out. Put in pan and brush with melted butter. Let rise to double again. Bake at 400째 until brown.

These rolls have become a Thanksgiving tradition in our family. But they are great anytime!

title: 79. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY COBBLER
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY COBBLER

ingredients

2 (16 oz. each) cans sliced peaches in light syrup, drained
1 (16 oz.) can whole berry cranberry sauce
1 pkg. Duncan Hines bakery style cinnamon swirl muffin mix
1/2 c. chopped pecans
1/3 c. butter or margarine, melted
whipped topping or ice cream

preparation

Preheat oven to 350째. Cut peach slices in half lengthwise. Combine peach slices and cranberry sauce in ungreased 9-inch square pan. Knead swirl packet from mix for 10 seconds. Cut off one end of packet. Squeeze contents evenly over fruit.

Combine muffin mix, topping packet from mix and pecans in large bowl. Add melted butter. Stir until thoroughly blended (mixture will be crumbly). Sprinkle crumbs over fruit. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until lightly browned and bubbly. Serve warm with whipped topping or ice cream.

title: 65. THANKSGIVING PUMPKIN CRUNCH
info:
THANKSGIVING PUMPKIN CRUNCH

ingredients

1 (29 oz.) can pumpkin
1 (13 oz.) can evaporated milk
3/4 c. sugar
3 eggs, beaten
1/4 tsp. pumpkin pie spice mix
1/4 tsp. cinnamon
1 yellow cake mix
1 c. nuts
2 sticks melted butter, cooled
1 large Cool Whip

preparation

Line 9 x 13-inch pan with wax paper. Mix first 5 ingredients and pour in pan. Shake dry cake mix and nuts over this. Dribble melted butter on top. Bake at 350째 for 50 to 60 minutes. Cool, invert pan, remove wax paper and top with Cool Whip when ready to serve. "Better than pumpkin pie".

title: 98. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

1 can cranberry sauce
1 (3 oz.) box raspberry jello
grated rind of one small orange
1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
1 diced apple
pinch of salt

preparation

Dissolve jello in one cup hot water and pineapple juice. Melt cranberry sauce in saucepan on low heat until smooth and mushy. Mix with all other ingredients and chill until thickened and then add diced apple. Spoon into 8-inch square dish, sprayed with Pam or salad oil for easy removal. Chill until firm. Cut in squares and serve on lettuce with mayonnaise or Cool Whip. Serves 8.

title: 24. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

1 pkg. Knox's gelatin
2 Tbsp. chopped nuts
1/4 c. diced celery
1/2 c. orange juice
1/2 apple unpeeled but diced
1/4 tsp. salt
1/2 can cranberry sauce
1/4 c. cold water
3 c. diced red delicious apples
1 tsp. lemon juice
1/2 c. celery
1/4 c. coarsely chopped walnuts
1/3 cup mayonnaise

preparation

Stir gently to mix. Mound on a bed of lettuce.

Serves 4.

title: 53. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

2 large sugar-free jellos (raspberry)
1 can crushed pineapple, drained
1 can whole cranberry sauce
1/2 c. nuts, chopped

preparation

Dissolve jello and let it start to set up. Add pineapple, cranberry and nuts.

title: 17. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

1 small pkg. red jello
1 c. hot water
1/2 c. pineapple juice
1 c. sugar
1 c. whole cranberries
1 can pineapple cubes, drained
3 red apples
1 orange
1 c. nut meats

preparation

Dissolve Jello and sugar in the hot water. Add juice and cool. Grind cranberries, oranges with the skin and apples, cored, with the skin. Add to above mixture Add nut meats. Place in mold and cool until set.

title: 22. SOUTHERN CORNBREAD THANKSGIVING STUFFING
info:
SOUTHERN CORNBREAD THANKSGIVING STUFFING

ingredients

Cornbread (recipe follows)
7 slices oven-dried white bread
1 sleeve saltine crackers
2 c. celery, chopped
1 large onion, chopped
8 Tbsp. butter
7 c. chicken stock
1 tsp. salt
freshly ground black pepper
1 tsp. sage (optional)
1 Tbsp. poultry seasoning (optional)
5 eggs, beaten

preparation

Preheat oven to 350째. In a large bowl, combine crumbled cornbread, dried white bread slices and saltines; mix together and set aside. In a large skillet, saut the chopped celery and onion in butter until transparent, approximately 5 to 10 minutes. Pour saut챕d mixture over cornbread mixture. Add the stock. Mix well; taste and add salt, pepper to taste, sage and poultry seasoning. Mix well. Add beaten eggs and mix well. Reserve 2 heaping tablespoons of this mixture for the giblet gravy. Pour mixture into a greased pan and bake until dressing is done, about 45 minutes. Serve with turkey as a side dish.

title: 87. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients

1 pkg. raw cranberries, ground
2 oranges, ground
1 small can crushed pineapple
1 c. sugar
2 (3 oz.) pkg. raspberry Jell-O
2 c. boiling water
1 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water. Mix pineapple and sugar together and add to Jell-O. Put into refrigerator until slightly jelled. Add oranges, cranberries and nuts. Put into a mold for a beautiful congealed salad.

title: 95. CHILDREN'S THANKSGIVING TURKEY
info:
CHILDREN'S THANKSGIVING TURKEY
(Non Edible)

ingredients

1 large apple
raisins
1 large green stuffed olive

preparation

You will also need round toothpicks.

Clean apple; place a drop of vegetable oil on it to polish and make shiny. Place 2 toothpicks 1-inch apart on the narrower side of the apple. Place 1 toothpick on the back of the apple to balance the apple, allowing it to stand alone on toothpick "legs." Thread raisins onto 12 to 16 toothpicks, filling the toothpicks except for the a small tip to pierce the apple. Arrange the raisin toothpicks in 2 rows fanned out and stuck into the back side of the apple to form the "turkey's feathers." Place 1 toothpick deep into the front of the apple to give him a "neck." Stick a large olive on his "neck," and gently pull the pimento out to give him a "gobbler."

title: 159. THANKSGIVING CHOWDER
info:
THANKSGIVING CHOWDER

ingredients

8 slices bacon, fried until crisp
1/4 c. bacon grease
2 c. chopped onions
4 c. chopped potatoes
1/2 c. chopped celery
2 c. turkey broth
1/2 tsp. salt
4 c. turkey, cooked and cut up
1 can whole kernel corn
1 can cream-style corn
1 pt. half and half
dash of coarsely ground pepper

preparation

Fry bacon. Drain and reserve. Saute until tender the onions in bacon grease. Then add potatoes, celery, turkey broth and salt. Simmer, covered, until potatoes and celery are tender. Add turkey, whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, half and half and ground pepper. Heat thoroughly.

When serving, crumble the bacon on top and sprinkle with a little parsley. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: 135. A THANKFUL THANKSGIVING
info:
A THANKFUL THANKSGIVING

ingredients

One day full of gathering together and sharing conversation
A bunch of family and friends
A household of happiness
A handful of good memories
Three tons of love and kindness
Three hours of eating and sharing food

preparation

Start with a houseful of happiness. Add a bunch of family and friends. Next include three hours of eating and sharing food. Throw in three tons of love and kindness. Mix together with a day full of gathering and sharing conversation. Leave with one handful of good memories. Makes one Thankful Thanksgiving.

By Mrs. Hamilton's Fifth Grade, November '93.

title: 103. THANKSGIVING DINNER MEATBALLS
info:
THANKSGIVING DINNER MEATBALLS

ingredients

3 c. stuffing mix seasoning pack (dry) or Orowheat
1 small onion, chopped
1 1/2 c. Cheddar cheese, grated
1 c. walnuts, chopped
seasoned bread
4 eggs
1/3 c. water
sprinkle parsley (fresh or dried)

preparation

Mix ingredients together and let set awhile, even overnight is okay. Shape into approximately 16 balls. Place meatballs in serving dish and cover with sauce. Bake, covered, for 45 minutes at 350째.

Sauce:

ingredients

1 can cream of mushroom soup (do not add milk or water)
1/3 c. water
2 c. sour cream

preparation

Mix together and pour over meatballs.

Optional: May sprinkle some Cheddar over top of sauce.

title: 128. THANKSGIVING SAUSAGE DRESSING
info:
THANKSGIVING SAUSAGE DRESSING

ingredients

1 lb. pork sausage
2 medium onions, diced
4 stalks celery, diced
5 c. cornbread crumbs
3 c. white bread cubes, toasted
2 tsp. rubbed sage
1/4 tsp. pepper
2 to 3 1/2 c. chicken or turkey broth
2 eggs, beaten

preparation

Cook sausage, onions and diced celery in a skillet over medium heat until sausage is brown. Drain. Add remaining ingredients; stir well. Spoon into a 9 x 13-inch greased baking dish. Bake at 350째 for 30 minutes. Yield: 8 to 10 servings.

A great holiday dish!

title: 94. THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

8 to 10 slices dry bread
1 Tbsp. margarine
2 stalks celery, diced
2 eggs
1/2 c. dry milk
1 c. water
1/2 c. chicken livers, chopped, 1/2 c. ground beef or 1/2 c. ground pork
1 Tbsp. Gourmet chicken spice
1 tsp. sage
1/4 tsp. pepper

preparation

Mix bread, celery, margarine, spices and chicken livers. Add water and mix. Beat eggs and dry milk. Add to bread mixture. Bake at 350째 for 1 hour. Stir after 15 minutes. Continue baking.

Why I like (or memories of) my grandma or grandpa's recipe: It's good! She makes it every year for Thanksgiving.

title: 99. THANKSGIVING PEACHES
info:
THANKSGIVING PEACHES

ingredients

1 large can peach halves
1/3 c. brown sugar
1/4 tsp. cinnamon
dash of cloves and nutmeg
4 tsp. cornstarch
marshmallows

preparation

O, the comfort, the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person. Having neither to weigh thoughts, nor measure words, but pouring them right out, just as they are!! Chaff and grain together. Certain that a faithful hand will take and sift them. Keep what is worth keeping and with the breath of kindness, blow the rest away. Amen.

title: 61. THANKSGIVING PILGRIM PUNCH
info:
THANKSGIVING PILGRIM PUNCH

ingredients

3 c. cranberry juice
2 c. orange juice
3 c. ginger ale
3 scoops orange sherbet

preparation

Stir juices and ginger ale; add sherbet. (Should be easiest recipe in book!)

title: 85. PAT'S THANKSGIVING POTATOES
info:
PAT'S THANKSGIVING POTATOES

ingredients

10 medium potatoes, boiled and peeled
1/2 c. butter
1 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
1 c. scalded milk
8 oz. cream cheese (room temperature)

preparation

Mash potatoes with all ingredients. Put into a casserole dish and refrigerate until 2 to 3 hours before needed. Bring to room temperature and bake at 325째 for about 25 minutes.

title: 108. TENNEFOS FAMILY THANKSGIVING FRUIT COCKTAIL
info:
TENNEFOS FAMILY THANKSGIVING FRUIT COCKTAIL

ingredients

10 to 15 oranges
5 grapefruit
1 bunch red grapes (seedless)
1 bunch green grapes (seedless)
unsweetened orange juice
1 (8 oz.) small jar maraschino cherries

preparation

Peel, section and de-membrane oranges and grapefruit. Wash and separate grapes. Cut cherries in half, reserving the juice. Mix fruit in large bowl. Cover with orange juice and add maraschino cherry juice.

title: 117. THANKSGIVING TURKEYS
info:
THANKSGIVING TURKEYS

ingredients

12 Oreo cookies
1 can chocolate icing
12 small cinnamon red hots
12 malted milk balls
1 bag candy corn

preparation

Open all the cookies and spread icing on each side. On one side of the cookie, press the candy corn, fat end toward the edges to form tail feathers. On the other cookie side, press the malted milk ball into the icing to form the turkey's body, then press the red hot in front of the malted milk ball to form its "beard." Using icing as "glue," attach the "tail" half to the "body" half. Happy Thanksgiving!

title: 70. NO FAIL THANKSGIVING TURKEY
info:
NO FAIL THANKSGIVING TURKEY

ingredients

12 to 15 lb. turkey
1 loaf stale bread, cubed
1 1/2 c. chopped onion
1 c. celery, cut up
1 Tbsp. dried parsley
3 eggs or egg substitute
1/2 stick margarine
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Defrost turkey in refrigerator. Remove neck and giblets. Wash turkey in cool water. Pat dry. Melt margarine in large pan. Saute chopped liver until no longer pink. Add onion, celery and parsley and saute until soft. Add bread cubes and mix. Add beaten eggs or egg substitute. Mix well. Generously sprinkle turkey cavities with salt. Spoon in stuffing, but do not pack. Brush outside of turkey with melted margarine. Place in roaster on rack. Cover with foil tent. Refer to turkey packaging for proper cooking times.

title: 139. THANKSGIVING POT PIE
info:
THANKSGIVING POT PIE

ingredients

1/2 c. dried cranberries
1/2 c. dry sherry
4 medium leeks, cleaned and sliced into 1/2-inch pieces (white part only)
4 carrots, cut into 1/4-inch pieces
8 oz. mushrooms, quartered
4 c. cooked turkey, shredded
3/4 c. frozen peas
2 tsp. dried tarragon
1/2 c. parsley, chopped
2 c. chicken broth
3 Tbsp. unsalted butter
3 Tbsp. flour
1 sheet frozen puff pastry
finely grated zest of 1 orange (optional)
1 egg, lightly beaten

preparation

Soak cranberries in sherry. Set aside. Boil water; add carrots and cook until tender, about 2 minutes. Add leeks and cook about 1 1/2 minutes. Drain. Cook mushrooms in 1 tablespoon oil about 5 minutes. Mix together turkey, drained cranberries (reserve sherry) and all vegetables. Add tarragon, parsley and orange zest. Heat broth and sherry. Melt butter over medium low heat; add flour and cook, stirring, until it browns lightly, about 3 minutes. Slowly whisk in hot broth and whisk over medium-high heat until thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Fold white sauce into vegetables and meat and remove to a round 2 to 3-quart casserole dish.

On a lightly floured surface, roll thawed puff pastry into a circle about 2 inches larger than casserole. Place pastry over top of casserole and crimp edges. With knife, make 3 slits in top. Brush top of crust with egg wash. Bake at 350째 for 40 to 45 minutes.

title: 105. GRANNY'S THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
GRANNY'S THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

4 c. cornbread
2 c. white bread
4 1/2 c. chicken broth
1 c. chopped celery
1/2 c. chopped onion
2 boiled eggs
1/2 Tbsp. sage

preparation

Mix all ingredients. Be sure to brown onion and celery first. Put in a greased pan. Bake at 375째 for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: 126. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

red leaf lettuce
romaine
sliced cucumbers
seasoned croutons

preparation

Combine ingredients to taste.

Dressing:

ingredients

1 part sour cream (imitation sour cream or sour half and half works just as well)
2 parts mayonnaise (low-fat mayonnaise works just as well)
1 part crumbled Bleu cheese

preparation

Combine sour cream, mayonnaise and Bleu cheese for dressing. Ring dressing with seasoned pepper. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours. Just before serving, mix seasoned pepper into dressing. Toss dressing with salad and serve.

title: 93. FAKE THANKSGIVING TURKEY
info:
FAKE THANKSGIVING TURKEY

ingredients

2 cans Fry-chick and juice, mashed or ground up in blender
1/2 c. ground up nuts (walnuts or pecans)
3 slices bread, torn in pieces
1/2 c. hot water
1 medium onion, chopped
2 Tbsp. chicken flavor vegetarian soup broth (dry)
1/2 c. soy Cheddar cheese, grated (optional)

preparation

Mix all ingredients well and pour into greased bread pan and sprinkle top lightly with Kellogg's poultry seasoning.

For gravy, use "Gravy Quick" chicken style or:

Gravy:

ingredients

1 onion, chopped
margarine or butter
1 c. water
2 to 3 Tbsp. veg chicken style soup base
2 to 3 Tbsp. flour

preparation

Saute onion in margarine or butter; add water and veg chicken style soup base. Make runny mixture of flour and water and add slowly while stirring over heat to thicken.

title: 48. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

1 small can crushed pineapple
1 small pkg. raspberry Jell-O
1/2 c. pecans
3 oz. cream cheese
1 1/2 c. boiling water
1 c. whole berry cranberry sauce

preparation

Mix the Jell-O and water; dissolve. Cream the cream cheese. Add pineapple with juice. Add remaining ingredients and mix with Jell-O. Chill until congealed.

title: 82. A TASTE OF THANKSGIVING
info:
A TASTE OF THANKSGIVING

ingredients

16 oz. frozen egg noodles
2 c. cooked turkey, diced
2 oz. pimento, chopped
10 oz. pkg. frozen peas and carrots
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1/2 c. milk
1 c. water
3 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

preparation

Cook noodles in boiling water for 20 minutes. Drain. Combine noodles, turkey, pimento and peas and carrots in large mixing bowl. In saucepan, combine soup, milk, water and cheese. Heat to boiling point, stirring frequently to prevent scorching. Pour cheese sauce over other ingredients and mix. Place entire noodle mixture into 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Bake at 375째 for 30 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

title: 26. HAPPY THANKSGIVING BLESSING MIX
info:
HAPPY THANKSGIVING BLESSING MIX

ingredients

2 c. Bugles chips
2 c. pretzels
1 c. plain M&M's
1 c. candy corn
1 c. dried fruit
1 c. peanuts

preparation

Mix together and package in little bags.

Bugles represent the cornucopia and signifies prosperity.

Candy corn represents the harvest of corn. The pilgrims were allowed only 5 kernels of corn per day.

Pretzels represent arms folded in prayer of Thanksgiving.

Dried fruit represents the harvest celebration.

Nuts represent the seeds of the harvest.

title: 151. THANKSGIVING DAY WILD RICE STUFFING
info:
THANKSGIVING DAY WILD RICE STUFFING

ingredients

1 1/2 lb. sliced mushrooms
2 c. chopped celery
2 c. chopped onions
1 c. butter
6 c. cubed, whole wheat bread
1 c. chopped pecans
2 tsp. sage
1 tsp. thyme
1/2 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 c. chicken broth
1 1/2 c. cooked, wild rice, cooled

preparation

Saute, in 1/2 cup of butter, then onions, mushrooms and celery; salt lightly. In large bowl, combine bread, pecans and seasonings. Add sauteed vegetables. Saute wild rice in remaining 1/2 cup butter and chicken broth; simmer 5 minutes. Add rice to bread mixture. Combine thoroughly. Makes 12 cups. Will stuff a 12 to 14 pound turkey, or cook separately for 40 minutes in a covered dish.

title: 19. THANKSGIVING CHICKEN CASSEROLE
info:
THANKSGIVING CHICKEN CASSEROLE

ingredients

4 large chicken breasts
1 small pkg. pepperidge farm corn bread dressing
1 stick margarine
1 small onion - chopped fine
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 can cream of chicken soup
celery and sage if desired

preparation

Stew chicken until done (do not salt). Remove meat from bones. Reserve broth. Melt margarine and stir in dressing and onions (celery and sage). In a greased 9 x 13 casserole dish, begin with a layer of dressing crumbs. Add a layer of chicken, then a layer of mushroom soup, diluted with 1 can of reserved chicken broth. Again, a layer of crumbs and chicken, then a can of cream of chicken soup diluted with 1 can of reserved chicken broth. Top with crumbs and margarine. Bake at 350째 for 35 minutes or until top is brown. Serves 10 - 12.

title: 32. THANKSGIVING TURKEY COOKIES
info:
THANKSGIVING TURKEY COOKIES

ingredients

chocolate stars
chocolate covered cherries
candy corn
fudge stripe round cookies
chocolate frosting

preparation

For each turkey you will need 2 chocolate stars for the feet, 1 chocolate covered cherry or candy of similar size and shape for the body, 2 candy corn for the head and 1 cookie for the tail feathers.

With frosting , "glue" the body to the feet. The body is the chocolate cherry on its side. Glue the fudge stripe to the bottom of the chocolate cherry so the fudge stripe is upright. Glue the corn to the body so one is on top pointing forward and one is on the front pointing down.

title: 55. THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

turkey or hen broth
corn meal (Martha White)
2 eggs
milk
Crisco shortening
4 small onions, minced
3 stalks celery (without ribs), minced
3 cans cream of chicken soup
salt and pepper to taste
1/2 tsp. (heaping) sugar
5 eggs
1 stick butter

preparation

Bake 2 iron skillets of cornbread as per directions on back of Martha White package. Bake at 450째 for 20 to 25 minutes.

Saute onions and celery in 1 stick butter. In large bowl, break up cornbread into crumbs.

Add soup and 1 can water to dilute soup. Add turkey broth, enough to have a good consistency (pourable but not too liquidy). Mash with potato masher until creamy. Add onions and celery before or after mashing to your liking. Add 5 eggs. Stir well. Pour in 9 x 13-inch pan. Cook at 350째 until golden brown all over.

title: 50. THANKSGIVING SQUASH
info:
THANKSGIVING SQUASH

ingredients

2 lb. squash
1 large onion
salt and pepper to taste
1 stick oleo
1/2 pkg. dry stuffing mix
8 oz. sour cream
1/2 chopped green pepper
1 jar chopped mushrooms
2 grated carrots

preparation

Simmer squash, onion, salt and pepper until tender and drain well. Mix well oleo, dry stuffing mix, sour cream, carrots, green pepper and mushrooms. Add squash and mix together very well. Place in casserole dish and top with stuffing mix. Bake at 350째 for 30 minutes (45 minutes at 325째 if Corning Ware is used).

title: 90. THANKSGIVING APPLE CAKE
info:
THANKSGIVING APPLE CAKE

ingredients

3 eggs
1 1/2 c. oil
2 c. sugar
3 c. flour
1/4 c. milk
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. soda
1 tsp. salt
2 tsp. vanilla
3 c. chopped apples
1 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Combine all ingredients in order; spread evenly in 9 x 13-inch greased pan. Bake 1 hour at 350째.

Topping:

ingredients

1 stick butter
1/4 c. milk
1 c. brown sugar

preparation

Bring to boil; cook 2 1/2 minutes. Spread on warm cake.

title: 115. THANKSGIVING CIDER
info:
THANKSGIVING CIDER

ingredients

2 qt. chilled cranberry juice
1 can frozen pink lemonade concentrate
1 qt. ginger ale

preparation

Empty the cranberry juice into a punch bowl. Stir in the frozen lemonade until melted. When you are ready to serve, pour in the ginger ale.

title: 74. THANKSGIVING SQUASH
info:
THANKSGIVING SQUASH

ingredients

2 lb. squash
1 can cream of chicken soup
1 small can mushrooms
8 oz. sour cream
1 large onion
1 carrot, grated
1 stick butter
1 box Stove Top stuffing mix
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Cook squash and drain well. Slice onion, grate carrot, add butter and cook in microwave oven for 3 minutes. Mix cooked onion and carrot, sour cream, mushroom soup, salt, pepper, squash and 3/4 stuffing mix. Pour into casserole. Mix remainder of stuffing with melted butter and top casserole. Bake at 350째 for 30 to 40 minutes.

title: 89. THANKSGIVING JELLIED SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING JELLIED SALAD

ingredients

1 (9 oz.) can pineapple chunks
2 pkg. cherry jello
2 c. hot water
2 Tbsp. lemon juice
dash of salt
3/4 c. sugar
1 1/2 c. coarsely ground cranberries
1/2 c. finely ground orange with peel
1 c. mandarin oranges
3/4 c. celery, chopped
1/3 c. walnuts, chopped
1 c. cold water

preparation

Drain pineapple; keep juice. Dissolve jello in hot water. Add cold water, pineapple juice and salt. Chill until partially set. Stir sugar into ground fruits; fold into jello. Add pineapple, oranges, celery and walnuts. Pour into ring mold. Chill until firm. Yields 8 to 10 servings.

title: 111. YUMMY YAMS - THANKSGIVING
info:
YUMMY YAMS - THANKSGIVING

ingredients

3 c. mashed sweet potatoes
1 c. granulated sugar
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 c. melted butter
2 eggs, beaten
1 c. brown sugar
1/2 c. flour
1 c. chopped walnuts
1/2 c. butter

preparation

Mix first 5 ingredients together. Top with a mixture of the last 4 ingredients. Bake at 350째 for 30 minutes. You can put a layer of marshmallows on top for the last 5 minutes of cooking.

title: 116. AUNT HARRIET'S THANKSGIVING DATE PUDDING
info:
AUNT HARRIET'S THANKSGIVING DATE PUDDING

ingredients

1 lb. dates, chopped fine
1 c. boiling water
1 tsp. soda
1 c. sugar
1 tsp. baking powder
1 tsp. butter
1 egg
1 c. chopped walnuts or pecans
1/2 c. sugar
2/3 c. boiling water
whipped cream

preparation

Pour the one cup of boiling water over half of the dates and add the soda. Let this mixture stand while you mix the next batch of ingredients. Sift (mix) flour, sugar and baking powder. Mix into the date, soda and water mixture and add beaten egg, butter and 1/2 cup of nuts. Blend well and spread mixture in a greased 10 x 15 x 1-inch pan. Bake at 350째 for 30 minutes. Spread over the top a sauce made by mixing the remaining 1/2 pound dates, 1/2 cup nuts and the 2/3 cup of boiling water. The sauce should be mixed while the cake is baking. The topping will remain moist and keep the cake moist. Serve slices with whipped cream.

title: 134. THANKSGIVING RICE
info:
THANKSGIVING RICE

ingredients

3 c. uncooked rice
1 lb. country sausage
1 c. celery, chopped
2 medium onions, chopped
1 green pepper, diced
1 egg, beaten
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Boil rice; set aside in colander. Use a large skillet to cook sausage thoroughly. Saute celery, onions and pepper in sausage fat. When vegetables are lightly browned, add the rice. Stir well for about 3 minutes. Remove from heat; put into a large mixing bowl. Combine with egg and seasonings. Mix well. Put into greased casserole dishes for serving or freezing. Reheat in oven until rice is hot. Yield: 12 to 14 servings.

title: 156. THANKSGIVING PUDDING
info:
THANKSGIVING PUDDING

ingredients

1 1/2 c. grape juice
8 eggs
1 1/2 c. sugar
1 large box vanilla wafers
1 medium bottle cherries
1 c. pecans
2 Tbsp. unflavored gelatin, dissolved in 1 c. warm water

preparation

Heat grape juice to boiling point; add gelatin and stir. Add egg yolks which have been creamed with sugar. Have egg whites beaten stiff; add to grape juice mixture and blend thoroughly. Remove from stove. In large bowl, alternate layers of wafers, cherries and nuts until all are used. Pour grape juice mixture over this and place in refrigerator to set. Serve with whipped cream. Makes a large amount.

title: 118. THANKSGIVING CORN CASSEROLE
info:
THANKSGIVING CORN CASSEROLE

ingredients

1/2 cup melted margarine
1 can cream style corn
1 can whole kernel corn
2 Tbsp. green peppers (chopped)
2 Tbsp. onion (chopped)
1 pkg. corn muffin mix
1/4 cup mayo
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
2 eggs well beaten
dash of salt, pepper and sugar

preparation

Mix all together and bake in a casserole dish for 1 hour at 325째 or until the center of the dish is firm to the touch.

title: 78. THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE
info:
THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE

ingredients

1/2 c. butter or margarine, softened
1 c. sugar
2 eggs
1 tsp. baking soda
1 c. buttermilk
2 c. all-purpose flour
1 (9 oz.) pkg. condensed mincemeat, crumbled

preparation

Cream butter in a large mixing bowl; gradually add sugar, beating well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating mixture well after each addition.

Dissolve soda in buttermilk, stirring well. Add flour to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk mixture, beginning and ending with flour. Mix well after each addition. Stir in crumbled mincemeat.

Spoon batter into 2 greased and floured 8-inch round cake pans. Bake at 300째 for 45 to 50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove layers from pans and let cool completely.

Spread Caramel Cream Frosting between layers and on top and sides of cake. Yields one 2-layer cake.

Caramel Cream Frosting:

ingredients

1 c. plus 2 Tbsp. sugar, divided
1/2 c. butter or margarine
1/2 c. whipping cream

preparation

Place 2 tablespoons of sugar in a saucepan; cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved and becomes golden brown in color. Set aside.

Combine remaining 1 cup of sugar, butter and cream in a medium saucepan; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in caramelized sugar. Return to a boil; cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat; beat until spreading consistency. Yields enough frosting for one 2-layer cake.

title: 125. THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD

ingredients

1 1/2 c. water
2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1/2 c. pecan pieces
1 (6 oz.) raspberry jello
1 (16 oz.) can whole cranberry sauce

preparation

Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add strawberries and cranberry sauce. Stir in nuts. Pour in mold. Refrigerate. Serve on lettuce leaves.

Salad Topping:

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2 c. marshmallow cream
1 c. sour cream
1 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice

preparation

Combine in bowl. Beat with electric mixer until well blended. Refrigerate.

title: 157. THANKSGIVING OR ANY DAY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING OR ANY DAY SALAD

ingredients

1 large orange jello
1 can crushed pineapple
2 c. buttermilk
1 regular size Cool Whip
1 can mandarin oranges
1 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Boil jello and pineapple together until jello melts. Refrigerate until thick, but not hard. Add buttermilk; mix thoroughly and refrigerate until thick. Then add Cool Whip, mandarin oranges and chopped nuts. Let set, then serve.

title: 129. THANKSGIVING PIE
info:
THANKSGIVING PIE

ingredients

1 measure of health, past or present
1 measure of family
1 measure of friends
1 ray of Sonlight (not sunlight)
1 whisper of hope
1 heartful of God's peace

preparation

Crust: Take one measure of thankfulness and thoroughly sift out all lumps of sin and selfishness with a Calvary sieve.* Add one heaping measure of patience and moisten with the water of God's Word until dough is pliable enough to stretch without tearing. Fit into heart-shaped container and bake at highest heat until very firm. Then fill with the following:

Filling: Combine seven measure of God's mercy with one heartful of God's love. Blend in one full individual realization of unqualified grace, and stir well. Then fold in the following ingredients, one at a time, alternating each addition with a generous measure of praise.

After all ingredients are combined, pour into prepared crust. Allow to settle and smooth out; top with a meringue of pure joy. Reheat until piping hot** and serve to the Lord.

*If in doubt as to ingredients, equipment or procedures, consult the Master Cookbook at once.

**This recipe will be unpalatable if served lukewarm! All ingredients must be imported from God's Kingdom -- do not substitute. The mixture will be sweet, and no additional sweeteners are necessary!

title: 144. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

1 box orange Jell-O
1 box lemon Jell-O
3 c. hot water
1 lb. cranberries
1 orange
3 apples
2 c. sugar

preparation

Grind cranberries. Cut orange and apples in very small pieces (I prefer to grind the apples). Add sugar to fruit and let stand while Jell-O cools. Just before it starts to set, mix in fruit and turn into mold or bowl.

title: 119. "AFTER THANKSGIVING" TURKEY CORN SOUP
info:
"AFTER THANKSGIVING" TURKEY CORN SOUP

ingredients

1 (16 oz.) portion cream-style corn
1 can chicken broth or 16 oz. homemade
2 c. cooked, diced turkey
1 1/2 c. seasoned mashed potatoes
1/4 tsp. dried thyme leaves, crushed
1 1/2 c. chopped, cooked green vegetable (broccoli, green beans or peas)
1/2 c. milk
1/8 tsp. pepper

preparation

In 4-quart saucepan over medium heat, heat the corn, broth, turkey, potatoes and thyme to boiling. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in green vegetable, milk and pepper. Heat through. Yields approximately 8 cups.

title: 102. THANKSGIVING POTATOES
info:
THANKSGIVING POTATOES

ingredients

10 large potatoes
butter
1 lb. Cheddar cheese
green onions to taste
milk
1 can cream of chicken soup
1 to 2 pt. sour cream

preparation

Peel and boil potatoes; drain. Mash potatoes. Add milk and butter as needed. Add cream of chicken soup to mixture. Layer mashed potatoes, sour cream and shredded cheese in a rectangular baking dish. (Spray sides and bottom of dish with a little Pam.) Last layer should have cheese on top. Sprinkle green onions on top. Cover with foil, bake 30 minutes at 350째.

title: 21. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) box cherry Jell-O
1 (3 oz.) box raspberry Jell-O
1 (15 oz.) crushed pineapple with juice
1/2 can whole cranberry sauce (note: can use whole can for more cranberry flavor)
1 or 2 apples (depending on size) and 1 or 2 oranges, ground or chopped fine
1 c. pecans, chopped coarse (if desired)

preparation

Dissolve gelatin in 1 1/2 cups hot water. Add all other ingredients. Mix and chill until set. Best if left overnight.

title: 154. THANKSGIVING PIE
info:
THANKSGIVING PIE

ingredients

1 c. sugar
1/2 c. butter
2 eggs
1 tsp. vinegar
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 c. coconut
1/2 c. pecans
1/2 c. raisins

preparation

Mix all ingredients. Put into a frozen pie crust. Bake at 325째 for 30 minutes.

title: 155. THANKSGIVING DINNER RICE
info:
THANKSGIVING DINNER RICE

ingredients

1 pkg. Uncle Ben's long grain and wild rice plus 3/4 c. regular long grain rice
1 1/2 c. water
1 tsp. salt
1/2 c. parsley flakes
1 small can mushrooms, chopped
1 medium chopped onion
1/2 c. chopped celery
3/4 c. chopped walnuts or whatever (sunflower seeds)

preparation

Prepare rice however is says on package, plus 1 1/2 cups of water. Saute the onion and celery in 2 tablespoons of oil until transparent. Add mushrooms, parsley and nuts; saute 1 to 2 minutes. Add this to rice and water. Cook until all water is absorbed (approximately 20 to 30 minutes).

title: 30. THANKSGIVING BAKED BEANS
info:
THANKSGIVING BAKED BEANS

ingredients

53 oz. can pork and beans
1/2 c. ketchup
1/4 tsp. mustard
1 1/2 Tbsp. brown sugar
1/4 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/4 c. onion, chopped (optional)

preparation

Pour sauce off top of pork and beans; save sauce. Combine sauce with rest of ingredients. Put baked beans in Corningware dish and combine with mixture. Cover and bake 1 hour at 375째.

Alternate Method: Pour 1 can Bush's baked beans into Corningware dish. Cover and bake 1 hour at 375째. (Shhh - don't tell my secret. These pass for the homemade.)

title: 39. THANKSGIVING MORNING BREAD
info:
THANKSGIVING MORNING BREAD

ingredients

2 pkg. dry yeast
1 c. warm water
1/4 lb. butter
1/2 c. sugar
3 whole eggs
2 extra egg yolks
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. grated lemon rind
6 to 7 c. all-purpose flour
1 c. fresh cranberries
3/4 c. hazelnuts
3/4 c. yellow raisins
1/4 c. light brown sugar
melted butter

preparation

Dissolve the yeast in the warm water. Cream the butter in a very large bowl and beat in the granulated sugar until it is no longer grainy. Add whole eggs and egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sprinkle in the salt and lemon rind. Add 4 cups of the flour. Mix, then stir in the dissolved yeast. Mix in 2 more cups of flour and as much of the last cup as you need to make a dough. Turn out on a floured board and knead for 7 to 8 minutes until smooth and elastic. Add a little more flour if dough seems sticky. Put dough in a buttered bowl, butter the top and cover. Let the dough rise until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.

Punch down and pat into flattened round. Mix cranberries, hazelnuts, raisins and brown sugar. Scatter mix on dough and knead into dough until evenly distributed. Cut dough into 3 pieces and shape each piece into a round. Put rounds in well buttered 1 pound coffee cans or shortening cans. Cover and let rise until it reaches top of can and is rounded at top. Bake in a preheated 350째 oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until the loaves test done. Remove them from cans and put them on a rack. Brush the tops with melted butter. These are also good iced or glazed.

title: 45. THANKSGIVING CORNBREAD
info:
THANKSGIVING CORNBREAD
(Easy)

ingredients

1/2 c. cornmeal
1/4 c. white flour
1/4 c. whole wheat flour
1 Tbsp. maple syrup
1 tsp. baking powder
1/2 tsp. salt
2 Tbsp. shortening or butter
1 egg
1/2 c. milk

preparation

Mix cornmeal, flours, maple syrup, baking powder and salt. Add shortening, egg and milk. Pour into buttered loaf pan. Bake at 400째 for 25 minutes. Serves 8. Easy for children to make.

title: 141. MRS. LOWELL'S THANKSGIVING CORNBREAD
info:
MRS. LOWELL'S THANKSGIVING CORNBREAD

ingredients

12 oz. corn muffin mix
4 eggs
8 oz. sour cream
1/2 stick melted butter
1 Tbsp. sugar
16 oz. creamed corn

preparation

Beat eggs in bowl. Add corn muffin mix, sour cream, corn, melted butter and sugar. Grease an 8 x 8-inch pan. Bake at 350째 for about 1 hour.

Kids love this moist, sweet bread. We bake it for our Thanksgiving feast.

title: 40. DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE
info:
DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE

ingredients

6 oz. pkg. white and wild rice mix (Uncle Ben's)
2 to 3 c. cooked, cubed turkey or chicken
2 Tbsp. diced onion
1 stalk celery, diced
1 c. water
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 can cream of chicken, celery or mushroom soup
8 oz. can sliced water chestnuts, drained
4 oz. can mushroom stems and pieces (undrained)
1/4 c. chopped, roasted almonds (optional)

preparation

In a 2-quart casserole, combine uncooked rice and packet of seasoning with remaining ingredients except nuts. Mix well. Bake, covered, at 375째 for 45 minutes. Remove cover; sprinkle with nuts and continue baking for 15 minutes or until rice is done. Makes 6 servings, 275 calories per serving.

title: 114. DIABETIC THANKSGIVING CHEESECAKE
info:
DIABETIC THANKSGIVING CHEESECAKE

ingredients

3 oz. box sugar-free jello (any flavor)
12 oz. lite Cool Whip
22 pkg. Equal
8 oz. pkg. light cream cheese
2 c. graham cracker crumbs
7 Tbsp. low-fat margarine

preparation

Dissolve jello in 1 cup warm water. Set aside to cool. Stir together 6 packages Equal with graham cracker crumbs. Add melted margarine. Press 2 cups of the mixture firmly in 9 x 13-inch pan. Reserve rest of crumbs for top.

Cream 16 packages Equal with cream cheese. Mix with jello. Stir in Cool Whip. Spread mixture on top of crust. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs. Chill 3 to 4 hours. Also freezes well. Makes 36 squares (37 calories per square).

title: 77. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH MOLD
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH MOLD

ingredients

1 medium orange
12 oz. fresh cranberries
1/2 c. sugar
1 (3 oz.) pkg. black cherry gelatin

preparation

Cut orange into small sections; remove seeds. Process orange, cranberries and sugar in food processor until fruit is coarsely chopped. Prepare gelatin using package directions. Chill until partially set. Add chopped fruit; mix well. Pour into large mold. Chill until set. Unmold onto serving plate. Garnish with orange slices and parsley. Chill until serving time. Yield: 8 servings.

title: 37. THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD

ingredients

2 c. water
6 oz. cranberry jello
2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen, sliced strawberries, thawed
16 oz. can whole cranberry sauce
1/2 c. pecan pieces
lettuce leaves

preparation

Dissolve jello in boiling water; cool. Add strawberries and cranberry sauce. Stir. Add nuts. Pour into 2-quart ring mold. Refrigerate overnight. Put on lettuce leaves to serve.

title: 25. UNCLE  THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
UNCLE THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

3/4 loaf of bread--Mom uses seasoned bread crumbs
2 large onions, diced fine
2 green peppers, diced fine
2 stalks celery, diced fine
medium jar stuffed olives, diced fine--Mom uses salad olives

preparation

Fry onion, celery, peppers and olives in a liberal amount of shortening--Mom uses butter--until celery is rather soft. Season with salt and pepper. Crumble bread and pour drippings from the bird on bread. Mom uses chicken bouillon cubes. Add mixture and mix. Moisten well and season to taste. Place in oven in greased baking dish 'till browned. 350 degrees about 45 minutes to an hour.

title: 52. THANKSGIVING PIE
info:
THANKSGIVING PIE

ingredients

2 c. fresh cranberries
1/2 c. walnuts
1/2 c. sugar
1 c. sugar
1 c. flour
1/2 c. melted butter
2 eggs

preparation

Butter a 10-inch pie pan or 2 small ones. Put cranberries, walnuts and 1/2 cup of sugar in pie pan and mix.

In a bowl, beat eggs well. Add 1 cup of sugar, flour and melted butter. Mix well and spread on top of cranberry mixture. Bake at 325째 for about 1 hour.

title: 62. ARIZONA BITTINGER'S THANKSGIVING FRUIT CAKE WITH LOLA SCHOPPERT'S
info:
ARIZONA BITTINGER'S THANKSGIVING FRUIT CAKE WITH LOLA SCHOPPERT'S

ingredients

1 c. butter or Crisco
1 c. sugar
4 eggs, beaten
2 c. Brer Rabbit molasses (yellow label)
1/2 c. each citron, orange peel, lemon peel
2 slices candied pineapple, cut up
1 tsp. soda
1 tsp. each: nutmeg, allspice and cloves
1/2 lb. English walnut kernels (1 lb. shelled) (Lola use 2 lb. nuts)
1 lb. currants
1 lb. seedless raisins
1/4 c. buttermilk
1/2 c. candied cherries
5 c. flour

preparation

Cream sugar and shortening well. Add beaten eggs, then the molasses; mix well. Add soda to buttermilk and beat until foamy, then add to other ingredients. Measure the flour and add the spices to it and sift together 2 to 3 times. Have the nut meats, raisins, currants and candied fruits in separate containers and take a couple of tablespoons of the flour and mix through each thoroughly. Start adding a handful of each to the first mixture along with the flour until all is in, then mix well.

Grease funnel pan and cut heavy brown paper to line the bottom and sides (such as a large grocery sack). Fill the pan 3/4 full and bake at 250째 (slow oven) for 2 1/2 hours or until tested done. After I put the batter in the pan, I decorate the top with thin slices of the candied pineapple and halves of candied cherries and halves of English walnuts. I get two cakes out of this batch.

title: 127. THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE
info:
THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE

ingredients

3 c. applesauce
3/4 c. oil
3 eggs
2 c. sugar
3 1/2 c. flour
1 lb. raisins
1 lb. candy orange slices
2 tsp. soda
4 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. nutmeg
1 tsp. salt
3/4 tsp. cloves
1 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Grease and flour (can use 1 long or 2 round cake pans). Preheat oven to 325째. Cream oil, sugar and eggs. Add dry ingredients alternately with applesauce. Add nuts, raisins and cut-up orange gum candy. Bake for 1 1/2 hours at 325째.

title: 44. THANKSGIVING STUFFING
info:
THANKSGIVING STUFFING

ingredients

1 lb. pork sausage (Bob Evans mild)
1 c. chopped celery
1/2 c. chopped onion
1/4 lb. (1 stick) butter
1 loaf white bread, cubed and dried
1/4 loaf whole wheat, cubed and dried
2 eggs
milk to moisten
poultry seasoning
1 can mushrooms, stems and pieces

preparation

Fry sausage. Pour off grease, drain on paper towels. Place in frying pan butter, celery and onion and fry until celery is soft. Pour over breadcrumbs. Add sausage. Mix together milk and eggs. Pour over crumbs and add poultry seasoning, to taste. Add mushroom pieces chopped fine. Stuff turkey and enjoy.

title: 112. EASY THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
EASY THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

1/4 c. butter or margarine
1 c. onions, chopped
1 c. celery, chopped
2 cans chicken broth
1 (16 oz.) pkg. seasoned croutons
2 c. apples, chopped
1 c. toasted pecans

preparation

Saute onions and celery in butter or margarine. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Toss in croutons, apples and pecans. Put in greased 12 x 8-inch pan. Bake at 375째 for 20 to 30 minutes.

title: 59. LYNN'S FOOLPROOF STUFFING FOR THANKSGIVING TURKEY
info:
LYNN'S FOOLPROOF STUFFING FOR THANKSGIVING TURKEY

ingredients

3/4 lb. mild pork sausage
1/2 c. butter or margarine
1 1/2 c. chopped celery
1 c. chopped onion
1/2 c. chopped carrot (or grated)
9 c. dry bread cubes
1 large apple, cored and finely chopped
1 tsp. ground sage
1/2 tsp. thyme, crushed
1/2 tsp. dried rosemary, crushed
1/4 c. snipped parsley
1/2 to 3/4 c. turkey or chicken broth
salt and pepper

preparation

In a large skillet, crumble sausage. Cook and stir until sausage is brown. Drain off all but 1/4 cup drippings. Add butter, celery, onion and carrot. Cook, stirring occasionally until onion is tender. In a very large bowl, combine bread cubes, apple, sage, thyme, rosemary, parsley and sausage mixture. Toss lightly. Add enough broth to moisten. Salt and pepper to taste. Use to stuff 1 (10 to 12 pound) turkey.

title: 86. THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE
info:
THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE

ingredients

4 large chicken breasts
1 pkg. Pepperidge Farm cornbread dressing
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 can cream of chicken soup
1 stick margarine

preparation

Stew the chicken until done (do not saute). Remove meat from bones; set aside. Reserve the broth. Melt the margarine; stir into the dressing. In a greased casserole dish, begin with a layer of dressing, then a layer of chicken. Next, layer the mushroom soup, diluted with one can of reserved chicken broth, a layer of dressing, then the rest of the chicken. Add a can of cream of chicken soup, diluted with one can of reserved broth. Top with the remainder of dressing. Bake at 350째 until brown (approximately 30 to 40 minutes).

title: 145. THANKSGIVING LEFTOVER CASSEROLE
info:
THANKSGIVING LEFTOVER CASSEROLE

ingredients

1 c. peas or leftover vegetables (can be more, depending on amount of dressing and turkey left)
1 c. uncooked noodles, cooked according to pkg. directions
1 pkg. onion soup mix (dried type)
1 pkg. mushroom soup mix (dried type)
1 can mushroom soup
gravy

preparation

Chopped turkey and dressing are mixed with leftover vegetables. Add enough cooked noodles with dried instant soup mixes. Add mushroom soup and enough gravy so mixture, when mixed all together, is moist. I have even added red pepper, green pea pods and corn. Pour into greased 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan. Bake at 350째 for 30 minutes.

title: 56. THANKSGIVING BEANS
info:
THANKSGIVING BEANS

ingredients

1 (16 oz.) can green beans
1 (16 oz.) can yellow beans
1 can sliced water chestnuts
1 can mushroom soup
1 can onion rings
1/2 c. bacon bits

preparation

Mix beans, bacon, chestnuts and soup. Place in casserole. Cover with onion rings. Bake at 350째 for 40 minutes.

title: 64. THANKSGIVING SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING SALAD

ingredients

1 pkg. lemon gelatin
1 c. hot water
1 pkg. cream cheese
1/2 c. crushed pineapple
1/2 c. chopped celery
4 Tbsp. mayonnaise
1/4 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water and allow to cool. Mix rest of ingredients. Stir into cooled gelatin. Put in mold and chill.

title: 142. THANKSGIVING KUCHEN
info:
THANKSGIVING KUCHEN
(Or Dyk Filler, As Lou Calls It)

ingredients

3 c. flour
2 c. sugar
2 c. pumpkin
2 tsp. baking powder
2 tsp. soda
1/2 tsp. cinnamon
4 eggs
1 c. cooking oil
1/2 tsp. salt
1 c. chopped nuts
6 oz. raisins
6 oz. chocolate chips

preparation

Sift dry ingredients together into a mixing bowl. Add eggs, oil, pumpkin and remainder of ingredients; mix thoroughly. Lightly oil and flour a tube pan so batter will not stick. Add batter. Bake in a 350째 oven for about 1 hour and 10 minutes. Drizzle with orange frosting after cake is baked and cooled. I prefer cake plain or with powdered sugar.

title: 20. THANKSGIVING WALDORF SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING WALDORF SALAD

ingredients

2 bananas, sliced
2 fresh pears, cored and diced
1/2 c. celery, diced
1/4 c. broken walnuts or pecans (or both)
2 Tbsp. Miracle Whip salad dressing
2 Tbsp. sour cream
1 Tbsp. lemon juice
1 Tbsp. sugar or honey
1/8 tsp. ginger

preparation

Place first four ingredients in salad bowl. Combine remaining ingredients, mix well. Pour over fruit. Toss lightly. Serve in lettuce lined salad bowls. Makes 4 servings.

title: 92. THANKSGIVING POTATOES
info:
THANKSGIVING POTATOES

ingredients

9 large baking potatoes, peeled and diced
1 stick butter (room temperature)
12 oz. cream cheese (room temperature)
3/4 c. sour cream
1/2 tsp. ground nutmeg
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Cook potatoes until tender. Drain. Place potatoes in bowl. Cut butter and cream cheese into small pieces and add to potatoes. Beat with mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in sour cream. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Serve immediately or reheat in a buttered casserole at 300째 for 20 minutes if prepared in advance. Makes 8 portions.

title: 123. THANKSGIVING COBBLER
info:
THANKSGIVING COBBLER

ingredients

1 pkg. yellow cake mix
1 tsp. cinnamon
1/4 tsp. nutmeg
1 c. butter, softened
1 c. nuts
1 can peach pie filling or 18 oz. peach preserves
1 (16 oz.) can whole berry cranberry sauce
vanilla ice cream or Cool Whip

preparation

Preheat oven to 350째. Combine dry cake mix and spices in bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Stir in nuts. Set aside.

Combine pie filling and cranberry sauce. Spread in ungreased 13 x 9-inch cake pan. Sprinkle crumb mixture over fruit. Bake 45 to 50 minutes, until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream or Cool Whip.

title: 133. THANKSGIVING TURKEY GRAVY
info:
THANKSGIVING TURKEY GRAVY

ingredients

4 c. chicken broth
4 c. water
2 carrots, halved
2 to 3 celery stalks, halved
1 large onion, quartered
turkey neck and giblets
turkey drippings
2 c. flour
1 c. butter, chilled
salt and pepper
sage, thyme and poultry seasoning

preparation

Combine first 6 listed ingredients and bring to boil. Reduce heat and cover, then simmer 1 hour. Cool a little, then strain, keeping liquid, neck and giblets. Discard vegies. (At this point you may freeze liquid and neck separately for up to 1 week.) Cut butter into flour and make four balls; put into freezer. Thaw liquid and neck day of dinner; add in salt, pepper and herbs to taste. Adding neck, giblets and drippings to liquid, bring to boil, then reduce to medium heat. Remove flour and butter balls from freezer. Place one at a time, in center of wire whisk. Stir whisk with ball into the liquid until dissolved. Repeat with each ball until desired thickness is achieved. Bring to low boil for 3 minutes to remove any flour taste.

title: 35. THANKSGIVING DRESSING
info:
THANKSGIVING DRESSING

ingredients

3 pkg. stuffing bread
2 onions, chopped
4 to 5 eggs
sage
salt
pepper

preparation

Mix bread, onions and eggs. Then add sage, salt and pepper to taste. Pour enough broth (from cooking giblets) in mixture to moisten. Stuff turkey.

title: 73. GRANDMA SCOLARO'S THANKSGIVING MEAT STUFFING
info:
GRANDMA SCOLARO'S THANKSGIVING MEAT STUFFING

ingredients

1 lb. hamburg
1 lb. ground pork
2 pkg. saltines, finely crushed
3 Tbsp. Bell seasonings
salt and pepper
1 large onion, chopped

preparation

Cook onion in oil in a large pan. Add the meat and cook fully. Mash crackers and add the Bell seasonings, salt and pepper. Add to the meat mix. Place in the turkey and cook.

title: 104. THANKSGIVING PIE
info:
THANKSGIVING PIE

ingredients

1 c. good thoughts
1 c. kind deeds
4 c. consideration for others
2 c. sacrifice for others
3 c. forgiveness
2 c. well beaten faults

preparation

Hugging is healthy; it helps our body's immune system, it keeps you healthier, it cures depression, reduces stress and induces sleep. It's invigorating and rejuvinating. It has no unpleasant side effects and hugging is nothing less than a miracle drug. Hugging is all natural. It is organic, naturally sweet. It has no pesticides, no preservatives and no artificial ingredients. And it is 100% wholesome. Hugging is practical.

title: 67. KRIEGER THANKSGIVING SQUASH
info:
KRIEGER THANKSGIVING SQUASH

ingredients

2 to 3 lb. cooked butternut squash
1 to 2 chopped onions
1/2 stick margarine
1 c. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
3 to 4 eggs
milk if needed
crushed Ritz crackers for topping

preparation

Saute onions in butter; add eggs. Combine all ingredients, except crackers. Pour into buttered 9 x 13-inch pan and top with crushed Ritz crackers. Bake at 350째 for 45 to 50 minutes.

title: 121. THANKSGIVING TOMORROW
info:
THANKSGIVING TOMORROW

ingredients

3 c. Stove Top dressing or homemade dressing
2 c. turkey, cooked and diced
1 c. cream of mushroom soup
1/2 c. diced celery
1/2 c. diced onion
1 tsp. poultry seasoning
1/2 tsp. pepper

preparation

Heat oven to 350째. Combine all ingredients, adding turkey broth or water if mixture is too dry (I use turkey gravy if any left). Place in lightly greased 1-quart casserole dish. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until hot and lightly brown on top. Garnish with cranberry jelly or sauce if desired.

title: 158. THANKSGIVING DINNER
info:
THANKSGIVING DINNER

ingredients

1 car (or any other mode of transportation)
1 tank of gas (depending on distance of travel)
1 empty stomach (or more depending on how many in your family)
1 safe trip to destination

preparation

Get up early on Thanksgiving Day and travel to the location of the dinner. (If the visit requires an overnight stay, be sure to pack.) Upon arriving at your destination, be prepared for luscious, mouth-watering smells. Help with any preparations or stay out of the way. Sit down at the table, say grace and enjoy, enjoy, enjoy! It is always a good idea to help with the clean up!

title: 138. THANKSGIVING DINNER
info:
THANKSGIVING DINNER

ingredients

1 car or some mode of transportation
1 tank of gas (depends on distance to drive)
1 pocketful of money (for gas; depends on ingredients #1 and #2)
1 empty stomach (or 2 if you bring your spouse, yes; and more if you bring the children)
1 safe trip to your mother's house

preparation

Depending on how far you drive (pack clothes for an overnight trip). Get up early on Thanksgiving day and go to your mother's house. If traveling a long distance, use plenty of ingredients 2 and 3. Upon arriving at your destination, prepare your nostrils for some luscious, moth-watering smells. Help your mother prepare a wonderful dinner (or stay out of the way). Sit down at the table, say grace and enjoy. To help make the dinner more enjoyable (especially to your mother) wash the dishes.

title: 68. THANKSGIVING APPLE-CHERRY PIE
info:
THANKSGIVING APPLE-CHERRY PIE

Flaky Pastry:

ingredients

2 c. flour
1 tsp. salt
2/3 c. shortening
2 Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
5 Tbsp. cold water
1 Tbsp. vinegar

preparation

Mix flour and salt well. Cut in shortening and butter until coarse crumbs. Add water and vinegar, mixing with fork. Form in ball. Roll out. Carefully lift to pie plate (pastry is tender and may tear). Makes pastry for 2-crust 8 or 9-inch pie or 2 shells.

Note: Very easy to handle and roll out; needs no chilling.

title: 72. CRANBERRY SALAD FOR THANKSGIVING
info:
CRANBERRY SALAD FOR THANKSGIVING
(Aunt Helen's Recipe)

ingredients

1 pkg. fresh cranberries
1 pkg. raspberry jello
1 c. chopped nuts
2 oranges, chopped
2 c. sugar
1 c. water

preparation

Dissolve jello in 1 cup boiling water. Cool. Add sugar to chopped fresh cranberries; then add oranges and nuts. Combine with jello and refrigerate to congeal.

title: 150. GRANDMA COLE'S THANKSGIVING JELLO
info:
GRANDMA COLE'S THANKSGIVING JELLO

ingredients

1 large pkg. lemon jello (may be sugar-free)
1 can pineapple tidbits, drained (save juice
1 small bottle maraschino cherries, sliced in half
1 small container cottage cheese
1 small tub Cool Whip

preparation

Mix jello, using juice from pineapple as part of water called for. Mix in fruit at this time, also. Let set. When set, fork jello apart. Mix cottage cheese and Cool Whip in.

title: 18. DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE
info:
DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE

ingredients

6 c. turkey stuffing
1 (16 oz.) can whole berry cranberry sauce
1/2 c. coarsely chopped walnuts (optional)
3 c. cubed, cooked turkey
1 (14 1/4 oz.) can turkey gravy

preparation

Prepare stuffing according to package directions. Stir cranberry and nuts into stuffing. In a 3-quart oblong baking dish, spoon stuffing. Arrange turkey pieces on top of stuffing. Pour gravy over turkey. Bake at 400째 for 20 minutes or until hot. Serves 6.

Four cups of turkey is good, too.

title: 84. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH CUPS
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH CUPS

ingredients

4 c. cranberries
2 c. sugar
2 oranges
1 lemon

preparation

Wash cranberries. Select large thin skinned oranges and lemon. Wash and cut in pieces, then put through food chopper, skins and all together with cranberries. Add sugar and mix well. Chill. Let stand at least 24 hours before serving. Serve in orange cups.

To make orange cups, cut small oranges in half. Scoop out pulp and flute edges of shells with scissors.

title: 124. THANKSGIVING HOT DISH
info:
THANKSGIVING HOT DISH

ingredients

2 lb. hamburger
3 stalks celery
1 box croutons
2 cans cream of chicken soup
1 c. water
1 onion
1 can cream of celery soup

preparation

Put raw hamburger in 9 x 13-inch pan, pat down slightly. Boil until tender 1 cup water, celery and onion. Pour this over 1 box croutons and add celery soup and 2 cans chicken soup. Pour this all over hamburger and bake 1 hour at 350째. Let stand 15 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

title: 71. THANKSGIVING DINNER IN A DISH
info:
THANKSGIVING DINNER IN A DISH

ingredients

6 c. seasoned bread cubes
2 Tbsp. oleo, melted
2 c. chicken broth
3 c. cooked chicken
1/2 c. chopped onion
1/4 c. chives
1/2 c. celery
1/2 c. mayonnaise
3/4 tsp. salt
2 eggs
1 1/2 c. milk
1 can cream of mushroom soup (10 3/4 oz.)
1/2 c. grated cheese

preparation

In medium bowl, mix bread cubes, oleo and 1 1/4 cups broth. In another bowl, mix chicken, 3/4 cup broth, chives, onion, celery, salt and mayonnaise. Spread 1/2 of bread mixture in greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Spread chicken mixture on top and top this with rest of bread mixture. Whisk eggs, milk and soup in bowl and pour over casserole. Bake at 350째 for 30 to 40 minutes.

title: 42. THANKSGIVING CROCK-POT DRESSING
info:
THANKSGIVING CROCK-POT DRESSING

ingredients

1 c. butter
2 c. chopped onion
2 c. chopped celery
1/4 c. parsley
2 (8 oz.) cans mushrooms, drained
12 to 13 c. slightly dry bread crumbs
1 tsp. poultry seasoning
1 1/2 tsp. salt
1 1/2 tsp. sage
1 tsp. dried thyme
1/2 tsp. pepper
1/2 tsp. marjoram
3 1/2 to 4 1/2 c. broth and giblets
2 well beaten eggs

preparation

Melt butter in skillet and saute onion, celery, parsley and mushrooms. Pour over bread cubes in very large mixing bowl. Add all seasonings and toss together well. Pour in enough broth to moisten; add beaten eggs and mix together well. Pack lightly into crock-pot. Cover and set at high for 45 minutes, then reduce to low to cook for 4 to 8 hours.

Note: If using a seasoned stuffing mix, omit herbs and salt.

title: 91. THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE
info:
THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE

ingredients

3 c. applesauce
3/4 c. shortening
3 eggs
2 c. sugar
3 1/2 c. flour (plain)
2 tsp. soda
1 tsp. salt
4 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. nutmeg
3/4 tsp. cloves
1 c. chopped nuts
1 lb. raisins
1 lb. orange slices, cut into 1/8-inch pieces (candy)

preparation

Cream shortening, sugar and eggs until light and fluffy. Sift all dry ingredients together. Add to cream mixture alternately with applesauce. Add nuts, raisins and orange slices. Bake 1 1/2 hours in a 350째 oven in a greased, paper-lined tube pan.

title: 66. THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY COBBLER
info:
THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY COBBLER

ingredients

1 pkg. Duncan Hines Deluxe yellow cake mix
1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
1/4 tsp. ground nutmeg
1 c. butter, softened
1/2 c. chopped nuts
1 can peach pie filling
1 can whole cranberry sauce
vanilla ice cream or whipped cream

preparation

Preheat oven to 350째. Combine dry cake mix, cinnamon and nutmeg in bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender or two knives until crumbly. Stir in nuts; set aside.

Combine peach pie filling and cranberry sauce in ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Mix well. Sprinkle crumb mixture over fruit. Bake at 350째 for 45 to 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

title: 113. THANKSGIVING EVE SPAGHETTI SAUCE
info:
THANKSGIVING EVE SPAGHETTI SAUCE

ingredients

1 (28 oz.) can crushed tomatoes
1 (12 oz.) can tomato paste
1 (28 oz.) can tomato sauce
7 chopped garlic cloves
1 large chopped onion
1 to 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
1 Tbsp. sugar
1/2 c. red wine (optional)
1/2 tsp. oregano
1/2 tsp. basil
1/2 tsp. marjoram
1/2 tsp. rosemary
salt and pepper
water (as needed for sauce consistency)

preparation

Brown ground beef, saving 1 to 2 tablespoons of drippings. Saute onions and garlic in drippings. Add crushed tomatoes. Add sauce. Add paste to onions and garlic. Add sugar and spices. Stir together well. Add ground beef; stir well. Let simmer for at least 3 hours. Serve over hot pasta.

title: 34. THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD
info:
THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD
(Make The Day Before)

ingredients

2 c. water
1 (6 oz.) pkg. raspberry-flavored gelatin
2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen sliced strawberries, thawed
1 (16 oz.) can whole cranberry sauce
1/2 c. pecan pieces
lettuce leaves

preparation

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Pour over the gelatin in a mixing bowl. Stir to dissolve the gelatin. Add the strawberries and cranberry sauce, stirring to break up the sauce. Stir in the nuts. Pour into a pretty 2-quart ring mold. Refrigerate overnight.

Before Thanksgiving dinner, unmold the salad on a large platter. (To help unmold the salad, run a knife around the edge of the mold. Dip the mold into warm water for a few seconds, being careful not to get water on the salad. Place serving platter over the top and turn over, holding both together.) Surround with lettuce leaves. Refrigerate and prepare the topping.

Topping:

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 c. dairy sour cream
1/3 c. sugar
1 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice

preparation

Combine cream cheese, sour cream, sugar and lemon juice in a small bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until well blended. Spoon into a serving bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 10 servings.

title: 36. TZIMMES DELUXE (GREAT FOR THANKSGIVING)
info:
TZIMMES DELUXE (GREAT FOR THANKSGIVING)

ingredients

2 large yams, peeled and cut into cubes
2 carrots, sliced
1/2 c. pitted prunes
1 c. water
1 apple, cored and cubed
honey to taste
walnuts can be added for crunch

preparation

Put yams, carrots, prunes and water in saucepan. Bring to a boil; cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until tender. Add apple and honey and cook 25 minutes longer. Preheat oven to 300째. Turn mixture into a heatproof serving dish and bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes. Yields 4 servings.

title: 31. THANKSGIVING CAKE
info:
THANKSGIVING CAKE

ingredients

2 1/2 cups cake flour
2 tsp. baking soda
2 tsp. baking powder
2 tsp. ground cinnamon
1 tsp. salt
2 cups crushed vanilla wafer cookies
1 cup chopped pecans
3/4 cup butter, softened
2 cups sugar
1 cup vegetable oil
4 eggs
15 oz. can pumpkin
1/4 cup caramel topping
1 cup pecan halves
pumpkin candies if desired

preparation

Heat oven to 350째. Grease and flour 3 round 8 1/2 inch cake pans. Mix cake flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt; set aside. Beat cookies, chopped pecans and butter in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed, scraping bowl occasionally, until crumbly. Divide among pans; press evenly on bottoms of pans. Beat sugar, oil, eggs and pumpkin in same bowl on medium speed 1 minute, scraping bowl constantly. Gradually beat flour mixture into pumpkin mixture on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Pour over pecan mixture in pans; spread evenly. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans to wire rack. Cool completely. Prepare Buttery Cream Cheese Frosting. Fill each layer with 1/3 cup of the frosting, placing layers with pecan side down. Frost sides and top of cake with remaining frosting. Spread caramel topping over edges of cake, allowing some to drizzle down the sides. Arrange pecan halves and candies on top of cake. Store covered in refrigerator.

Buttery Cream Cheese Frosting:

ingredients

2/3 cup butter, softened
3 oz. cream cheese, softened
3 cups powdered sugar
2 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Beat butter and cream cheese with electric mixer on low speed, scraping bowl frequently, until smooth. Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla on low speed until smooth and spreadable.

title: 96. THANKSGIVING CAKE
info:
THANKSGIVING CAKE

ingredients

1 1/2 c. oil
2 c. sugar
3 eggs
1/2 tsp. salt
1 tsp. soda
2 c. flour
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 (6 oz.) pkg. butterscotch chips
1 1/2 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Mix oil and sugar; add eggs and beat well. Stir in dry ingredients. Add apples, butterscotch chips, nuts and vanilla. Bake in 9 x 13-inch pan at 350째 for 50 to 60 minutes. While cake is warm, prepare topping.

Topping:

ingredients
